name: factory
content:
factory

noun
 
 
/ˈfæktri/,
 
/ˈfæktəri/
 
/ˈfæktri/,
 
/ˈfæktəri/
(plural factories)
jump to other results
  1. ​
    enlarge image
     
    a building or group of buildings where goods are made, mainly by machine
    • a car factory
    • The factory closed down ten years ago.
    • in/at a factory She works in the local textile factory.
    • factory workers
    Synonyms factoryfactory
    • plant
    • mill
    • works
    • yard
    • workshop
    • foundry
    These are all words for buildings or places where things are made or where industrial processes take place.
    • factory a building or group of buildings where goods are made, mainly by machine:
      • a chocolate/​cigarette/​clothing factory
    • plant a factory or place where power is produced or an industrial process takes place:
      • a nuclear power plant
      • a manufacturing plant
    • mill a factory that produces a particular type of material:
      • a cotton/​paper/​textile/​woollen mill
    • works (often in compounds) a place where things are made or an industrial process takes place:
      • a brickworks
      • a steelworks
      • Raw materials were carried to the works by barge.
    • yard (usually in compounds) an area of land used for building something:
      • a shipyard
    • workshop a room or building in which things are made or repaired using hand tools or machinery (usually individual items or small numbers of items):
      • a car repair workshop
    • foundry a factory where metal or glass is melted and made into different shapes or objects:
      • an iron foundry
    Patterns
    • a car/​chemical/​munitions factory/​plant
    • an engineering plant/​works
    • to manage/​run a factory/​plant/​mill/​works/​yard/​workshop/​foundry
    • to work in/​at a factory/​plant/​mill/​yard/​workshop/​foundry
    • factory/​mill/​foundry owners/​managers/​workers
    Wordfinder
    • assembly line
    • capacity
    • factory
    • foreman
    • plant
    • process
    • production
    • shift
    • shop floor
    • workforce
    Extra Examples
    • He works in a shoe factory.
    • They had to close the factory down in the recession.
    • capital to set up a ceramics factory
    • a chocolate/​cigarette/​clothing/​soap factory
    Topics Buildingsa2, Businessa2
    Oxford Collocations Dictionaryadjective
    • large
    • small
    • modern
    • …
    verb + factory
    • build
    • open
    • set up
    • …
    factory + verb
    • make something
    • produce something
    • open
    • …
    factory + noun
    • manager
    • owner
    • worker
    • …
    preposition
    • at factory
    • in factory
    See full entry
  2. ​a person or organization that continuously produces a large quantity of a particular thing
    • This record label has become a real hit factory (= one that produces a lot of successful songs).
    • (disapproving) These universities are becoming colourless degree factories, with no sense of what higher learning is really about.
    3. Word Originlate 16th cent. (originally referring to a place where traders did business in a foreign country): via Portuguese feitoria. The current sense is based on late Latin factorium, literally ‘oil press’.
See factory in the Oxford Advanced American DictionarySee factory in the Oxford Learner's Dictionary of Academic English

name: factory farm
content:
factory farm

noun
 
/ˈfæktri fɑːm/,
 
/ˈfæktəri fɑːm/
 
/ˈfæktri fɑːrm/,
 
/ˈfæktəri fɑːrm/
jump to other results
  1. ​a type of farm in which animals are kept inside in small spaces and are fed special food so that a large amount of meat, milk, etc. is produced as quickly and cheaply as possible
    • The pigs are raised on factory farms.
    compare battery farmTopics Farmingc1
See factory farm in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary

name: factory floor
content:
factory floor

noun
 
/ˌfæktri ˈflɔː(r)/,
 
/ˌfæktəri ˈflɔː(r)/
 
/ˌfæktri ˈflɔːr/,
 
/ˌfæktəri ˈflɔːr/
(often the factory floor)
[singular]
jump to other results
  1. ​the part of a factory where the goods are actually produced
    • Jobs are at risk, not just on the factory floor (= among the workers, rather than the managers) but throughout the business.
    • a worker on the factory floor
    Topics Businessc2
See factory floor in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary

name: factory farming
content:
factory farming

noun
 
/ˈfæktri fɑːmɪŋ/,
 
/ˈfæktəri fɑːmɪŋ/
 
/ˈfæktri fɑːrmɪŋ/,
 
/ˈfæktəri fɑːrmɪŋ/
 [uncountable] (British English)
jump to other results
  1. ​a method of farming in which animals are kept inside in small spaces and are fed special food so that a large amount of meat, milk, etc. is produced as quickly and cheaply as possible
    • the factory farming of beef, pork and chicken
    compare battery farmingTopics Farmingc1
Check pronunciation: factory farming

name: the Factory Acts
content:
the Factory Acts

noun
 
/ðə ˈfæktri ækts/,
 
/ðə ˈfæktəri ækts/
 
/ðə ˈfæktri ækts/,
 
/ðə ˈfæktəri ækts/
[plural]
jump to other results
  1. ​a series of British laws concerning safety and working conditions in factories. During the Industrial Revolution British factories were dangerous places to work in, and in most of them even young children had to work for long hours. People working for social change fought hard campaigns to force the government to make these laws. The most important Factory Acts were those passed in the first half of the 19th century. They limited the number of hours that children could work, and made it illegal to employ very young children.
Check pronunciation: the Factory Acts
